definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: The child puckered up her lips and began to smile innocently.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子抿了抿嘴唇，傻乎乎地笑了。

sentences.english: The child puckered up her lips and began to smile innocently.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子抿了抿嘴唇，傻乎乎地笑了。

sentences.english: I bought this magazine on the recommendation of friend.
sentences.chinese: 我由盂一位朋友推荐而抿滤这本书。

sentences.english: He sips his beer and gazes up at the Milky Way.
sentences.chinese: 他抿了一口啤酒望着天上的银河。

sentences.english: Sip tea, the subtle fragrance, best evoke the warm memories.
sentences.chinese: 抿一口茶，那淡淡的香味，最能勾起有关温馨的回忆。

sentences.english: I tried to sip the tea but it was scalding.
sentences.chinese: 我想抿一口茶，可是太烫了。

sentences.english: He took a sip of his coffee and then told me his story.
sentences.chinese: 抿了一口咖啡，他给我讲了自己的故事。

sentences.english: Mr. Wainwright watched me taste it and seemed to guess my feelings.
sentences.chinese: 温赖特先生看我微抿的样子，似乎猜出了我的心思。

sentences.english: Six little leave to close lightly tight lips, two eyebrows are wrinkly and tightly.
sentences.chinese: 陆少离抿紧唇，两道眉皱的紧紧的。

sentences.english: I would only have a few sips of the W-tini.
sentences.chinese: 而我只能抿几小口布什马丁尼。

sentences.english: Katherine took another sip from her glass to calm herself.
sentences.chinese: 凯瑟琳又抿了一口杯中的酒，竭力使自己镇静下来。

sentences.english: Ideally gums and palate are dark or black.
sentences.chinese: 理想的齿抿合和下额是深色的或黑色的。

sentences.english: The water was there, but no one could bear to drink but to sip when too thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 水就在那儿，可谁都舍不得喝，实在忍不住就抿一口。

sentences.english: Igel sipped his tea and stared at a point far off.
sentences.chinese: 伊格尔抿了口茶，盯着远远的某处。

sentences.english: And wrinkled lip, and sneer of cold command
sentences.chinese: 双唇紧抿，嘲笑般的神情似在下达冷酷的命令。

sentences.english: His mouth tightened into a thin line.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴抿成了一道细缝。

definition: the corners of the mouth/the lips
to drain the cup in one gulp (idiom)
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
to narrow one's eyes/to squint/(dialect) to take a nap
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
